Scener.Trivia:
Attention: I'm an asshole and most likely don't like that crap that you name art. Therefore i give bad votes, anonymously to cause more drama. However, feel free to think the same about my releases.
First joined Climax but after the group and the HQ got very inactive and i arrived as the only member at The Party 4, i got rather pissed off. On the Party 94 i met with the guys from Metalvotze that have freshly founded (i knew Drago already before that) and so i joined them. Equinoxe was just an intermezzo due to being frustrated with Climax in the end. As Metalvotze meanwhile consists only of a few active members who do all the great releases, i thought i'd better share the fame with better groups, like Oxyron.

Handle.HandleStory: Hahahaha, nothing more to say except the slogan of Danzig: Bierkeule Du bist so eklig!

Group.Name: Oxyron
Group.Slogan: fucker, vote a 10 or get lost

Group.Name: Equinoxe
Group.Trivia:
Equinoxe was mainly active in the legal part of the scene, releasing two of the most successful disk magazines ("Ingenious Brain" and "Shout!" in cooperation with Fairlight), some tools and sometimes even some small demos (such as the megademo FUEL in 1993). There were some very few cracks from EQX, too, but the group pretty soon established itself on the legal market and put emphasis on high-quality diskmagazines.
-
The group was founded in October 1993 by wARp (at that time called Mr Warp) and Traitor. It was a merge of the dying rests of the groups Viper and Fantasia.
Later on we released some small tools, and then finally, the first issue of our magazine Ingenious Brain (which got later replaced by Shout!), as well as our first megademo called Fuel.
We gained more members and respect in the scene, and then in September 1994 we released the second issue of Ingenious Brain, which shot up into the charts immediately. We kept on releasing tools, small demos, and of course our magazine. Then, after we released issue 5 of Ingenious Brain, wARp got the offer to join Fairlight and produce Reformation with them. He refused and Fairlight went into magazine co-operation with Equinoxe to produce Shout!. Shout!#1 had a high quality, some people consider it as the best single issue of a magazine ever released, and that had effects on the charts.
-
The "Ingenious Brain" magazine was hosted at "Red Board BBS", the German TRSI headquarters run by o.b./TRSI.

Group.Name: Metalvotze
Group.Slogan: We have computers which can beat your computers!
Willst Du ficken, kriegst Du ficken!

Group.Name: Arsenic
Group.Trivia: I was very astonished to see "arsenic" added to csdb - because it was an amiga group in 1996 and 1997 founded by yazoo and axis of oxyron (we became 2nd at mekka&symposium 1997 with our demo "fear factory" - check it out http://www.pouet.net/prod.php?which=3782). now we decided to kick some asses on c64 under the arsenic label.
